intro: Cedronella wrightii, commonly known as Wright's cedronella, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Cedronella wrightii is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its aromatic foliage and delicate blooms make it a distinctive addition to native plant gardens.
